alert.note: Alert for Carbon (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 22 at 8:10PM MDT until August 22 at 9:30PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE BEAR BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN CARBON COUNTY... At 810 PM MDT, UDOT reported that a debris flow was triggered within the Bear burn scar area, and encroached upon US 6 near the Castle Gate area, but did not cross the highway. Several softball sized rocks did have to be removed from the highway however. Between 0.5 and 0.75 inches of rain fell from the thunderstorms that produced this flow. Flash flooding is occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Bear Burn Scar. SOURCE...State DOT (UDOT) reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Bear Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Castle Gate, US 6 between mileposts 226-230. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
